English Sentences: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77ikka aissi gam77ai? Denddada xammaqetta; a sunttaa xeesaidda, ne nagaraappekka meecetta yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani guyye Yerusalaame simmada Beeta Maqidasiyan woossishin, taassi ajjuutai beettiis.

English Sentences: And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ajjuutan Godai tana, Eesotada, Yerusalaame elle kiya; aissi giikko, neeni taassi hagan markkattiyoogaa asai ekkenna yaagishin taani a be7aas.

English Sentences: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani, Ta Godau, Aihuda woosa keetta ubban nena ammaniyaageeta oiqqada wadhdhidoogaanne qasho keettan yeggidoogaa eti eroosona.

English Sentences: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ne markkaa Isxxifaanoosa woriyo wode, taani he yohuwaa maayaas. Qassi eta lanqqiyan eqqada, a woriyaageetu maayuwaa naagais yaagaas.

English Sentences: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Godai tana, Taani nena Aihuda gidenna asaakko haahosaa kiittiyo gishshau ba yaagiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they gave him audience unto this word, and then lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi he qaalaa haasayana gakkanaassi asai i giyoogaa ezggees; hegaappe guyyiyan, bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "Hagaa biittaappe xaissa; i de7anau bessenna" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti wocamishin, bantta maayuwaa bollau olishiininne baanaa carkkuwan laalishin,

English Sentences: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: shaalaqai wotaaddarati PHauloosa bantta de7iyoosaa efaana mala azaziis. Qassi asai aissi hegaadan wocamidaakko eranau, PHauloosa lissuwan garafiiddi qorana mala, eta azaziis.

English Sentences: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin wotaaddarati PHauloosa dafuwan mintti qachchido wode, PHauloosi ba matan eqqida mato halaqaa, "Roome katamaa asa pirddi bainnan wadhdhiyoogee inttessi higgee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa mato halaqai siyido wode, shaalaqaakko biidi, "Ha bitanee Roome asa. Neeni ai oottana qoppai?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaalaqai PHauloosakko shiiqidi, "Neeni Roome asee? Tau yoota" yaagiis. Yaagin PHauloosi, "Ee" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaalaqai PHauloosassi zaaridi, "Taani ha zaretettaa daro miishshan shammaas" yaagiis. SHin PHauloosi, "Taani he zerettaappe yelettaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, PHauloosa qoranau qoppidaageeti sohuwaara appe shaahetti aggidosona. SHaalaqaikka PHauloosi Roome asa gididoogaa erido wode yayyiis; aissi giikko, sanssalatan a qashissi wottiis.

English Sentences: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi shaalaqai, Aihudati PHauloosa aissi mootidaakkonne geeshshidi eranau koyidi, PHauloosa birshshiis. Birshshidi qeese halaqatinne yaa7ai ubbai shiiqana mala azaziis; qassi PHauloosa duge wottidi, eta sinttan essiis.

English Sentences: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi yaa7aa tishshi ootti xeellidi, "Ta ishatoo, taani hachchi gakkanaassikka Xoossaa sinttan ta de7o ubban lo77o zoriya wozanan de7aas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qeese ubbatu halaqai Hanaanee, PHauloosa doonaa baqqana mala, a matan eqqidaageeta azaziis.

English Sentences: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: for sittest thou to judge me after the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi he wode a, "Laa ha aannuwan tiyido godau, Xoossaikka nena baqqana. Neeni ta bolli higgiyan pirddanau uttada, higgee bainnan tana baqqana mala azazai?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosa matan eqqidaageeti a, "Neeni Xoossaa qeese ubbatu halaqaa cayai?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin PHauloosi, "Ta ishatoo, i qeese ubbatu halaqa gididoogaa taani erabeikke; aissi giikko, Ne deriyaa haariyaagaa bolli iita qaalaa haasayoppa geetettidi Xoossaa maxaafan xaafettiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin PHauloosi baggati Saaduqaaweta; baggati Parisaaweta gididoogaa be7idi, "Ta ishatoo, taani Parisaawenne Parisaawiyaa na7aa; Haiqqidaageeti haiquwaappe denddana gaada taani ufaissan naagiyo gishshau, eti ta bolli pirddoosona" yaagidi, xoqqu oottidi haasayiis.

English Sentences: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi hegaa yaagin, Parisaawetu giddooninne Saaduqaawetu giddon ooshshai kiyin, yaa7ai laalettiis.

English Sentences: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Saaduqaaweti, "Haiqqida asai denddenna; kiitanchchikka ayyaanikka baawa" yaagoosona; Parisaaweti qassi naa77aikka de7iyoogaa ammanoosona.

English Sentences: And there arose a great cry: and the scribes that were of the Pharisees' part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gita wocamai denddiis; Parisaawetu baggappe higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti denddi eqqidi, "Ha bitaniyaa bolli ainne bala demmibookko; ayyo ayyaani woi kiitanchchi haasayennan aggenna" yaagidi palamettidosona.

English Sentences: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring him into the castle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshai darin, shaalaqai PHauloosa eti mentterettanaakkonne giidi yayyidi, ba wotaaddarati wodhdhidi, eta giddoppe a eesuwan kessidi, bantta de7iyoosaa efaana mala azaziis.

English Sentences: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77antto qammi Godai PHauloosa lanqqiyan eqqidi, "PHauloosaa, neeni taassi Yerusalaamen markkattidoogaadan, Roomenkka markkattanau bessees; minna; aikko baawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi, Aihudati PHauloosa worana gakkanaas, meennaadaaninne uyennaadan, caaqettidi giigettidosona.

English Sentences: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosa bolli hegaa maqqida asati oitamaappe daroosona.

English Sentences: And they came to the chief priests and elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti qeese halaqatukkonne cimatukko yiidi, "Nuuni PHauloosa worana gakkanaas, ainne baarennaadan, qanggettidi caaqettida.

English Sentences: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we, or ever he come near, are ready to kill him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, inttenne yaa7ai PHauloosabaa geeshshidi qoriyaabaa misatidi, shaalaqai a inttekko duge wottana mala oichchite; nuuni i haa shiiqanaappe kase a woranau giigi uttida" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And when Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle, and told Paul.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin PHauloosa michchee na7ai he maqquwaa siyido wode, biidi wotaaddarati de7iyoosaa gelidi, PHauloosassi yootiis.

English Sentences: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to tell him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin PHauloosi mato halaqatuppe issuwaa xeesidi, "Ha na7aa shaalaqaakko efa; aissi giikko, shaalaqaassi i yootiyoobai de7ees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say unto thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, mato halaqai na7aa shaalaqaakko efiidi, "Qasho keettan de7iya PHauloosi, ha na7ai neessi aibakko odiyoobai de7iyo gishshau, tana baakko xeesidi, a neekko ehaanaadan, tana woossiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went with him aside privately, and asked him, What is that thou hast to tell me?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaalaqai na7aa kushiyaa oiqqidi, dumma gaxi kessidi, "Neeni taassi odanabai aibee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And he said, The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council, as though they would enquire somewhat of him more perfectly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7ai shaalaqaassi, "Aihudati PHauloosabaa kaseppe mintti oichchiyaabaa milatidi, neeni yaa7aa a wottanaadan, nena wontto woossanau zoretaa qachchidosona.

English Sentences: But do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, which have bound themselves with an oath, that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him: and now are they ready, looking for a promise from thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni eti giyoobaa siyoppa; aissi giikko, oitamaappe dariya asati PHauloosa worana gakkanaas, quma meennaadaaninne haatta uyennaadan, caaqettidi geemetti uttidi a naagoosona; neeni giyoobaa siyanau ha77ikka giigetti uttidi naagoosona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So the chief captain then let the young man depart, and charged him, See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, shaalaqai na7aa, "Ha yohuwaa neeni tana erissidoogaa oossinne odoppa" yaagidi azazidoogaappe guyyiyan, a yeddiis.

English Sentences: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaalaqai mato halaqatuppe naa77aa xeesidi, "Qiisaariyaa baanau, naa77u xeetu wotaaddarata, laappun tammu paraasatanne naa77u xeetu tooraasata qammaappe heezzu saatiyan giigissite;

English Sentences: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.
Wolaitta Sentences: deriyaa haariya Pilikisakko PHauloosa saro gattanau togissiyo mehenne giigissite" yaagidi, eta azaziis.

English Sentences: And he wrote a letter after this manner:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaalaqai Pilikisassi hagaadan giya dabddaabbiyaa xaafiis.

English Sentences: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Qalaudeyoosa Lusiyoosappe deriyaa haariyaagaassi, bonchcho Pilikisassi, sarotettai neessi gido.

English Sentences: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihudati ha bitaniyaa oiqqidi worana hanishin, Roome katamaa asa i gididoogaa erada, wotaaddaratuura gakkada a ashshaas.

English Sentences: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti a aissi mootiyaakko eranau koyada, eta yaa7aassi duge a wottaas.

English Sentences: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta higgiyaabaa i oichchidoogaassi a mootidoogaappe attin, a worissiya woi qashissiya mooto gidenna.

English Sentences: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent straightway to thee, and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ha bitaniyaa bolli maqetti uttido zigirssai tana gakkin, taani he sohuwaara a neekko yedda aggaas; a mootiyaageetikka biidi, ne sinttan mootana mala azazaas; saro de7a" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and brought him by night to Antipatris.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, wotaaddarati azazettidoogaadankka PHauloosa ekkidi, qammi Anttiphaaxiriisa gattidosona.

English Sentences: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi aara baanau paraasata wottidi, tohuwaasati guyye wotaaddarati de7iyoosaa simmidosona.

English Sentences: Who, when they came to Caesarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Paraasati Qiisaariyaa gelidi, dabddaabbiyaa deriyaa haariyaagaassi immidi, PHauloosa a sintti aattidosona.

English Sentences: And when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. And when he understood that he was of Cilicia;
Wolaitta Sentences: Deriyaa haariyaagee dabddaabbiyaa nabbabidoogaappe guyyiyan, PHauloosi awa auraajjaa asakko a oichchiis; Kilqqiyaa asa i gididoogaa erido wode,

English Sentences: I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani nebaa nena mootiyaageeti yiyo wode siyana" yaagidi, wotaaddarati Heeroodisa keettan a naagana mala azaziis.

English Sentences: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, and with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ichchashu gallassappe guyyiyan, qeese ubbatu halaqai, Hanaaniyaa, cimatuuranne Xarxxaluusa giyo issi xabaqaara duge Qiisaariyaa wodhdhiis; eti deriyaa haariyaagaa bolli PHauloosa mootidosona.

English Sentences: And when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi xeesettido wode, Xarxxaluusi a hagaadan yaagidi, mootuwaa doommiis. "Bonchcho Pilikisaa,

English Sentences: We accept it always, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.
Wolaitta Sentences: nuuni ne baggaara daro sarotettaa demmidaashin, ne qofan ha deriyaassi ubbaban ubbasankka lo77o laamee beettiyaagaassi nena daro galatidi, hagaa ekkoos.

English Sentences: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani nena gam77ettennan, ne kehatettan nubaa neeni qanttan siyana mala, nena woossais.

English Sentences: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ha bitanee xube gididi, sa7a ubban de7iya Aihudatu giddon ooshsha denttiiddi, Naaziraawetu bagga asaa kaalettiyaagaa gididoogaa erida.

English Sentences: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, and would have judged according to our law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harai atto Beeta Maqidasiyaakka tunissanau koyishin a oiqqidi, nu higgiyaadan, a bolli pirddanau qoppida;

English Sentences: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him away out of our hands,
Wolaitta Sentences: shin shaalaqaa Lusiyoosi yiidi, wolqqan nu kushiyaappe a wotti ekkiis.

English Sentences: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him.
Wolaitta Sentences: A mootiyaageetikka neekko yaana mala azaziis; neeni ne huuphen ha bitaniyaa qorada, nuuni a mootiyo yoho ubbaa eranau danddayaasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihudatikka qassi, "Ha yohoi tuma" giidi, a qofaa maayidosona.

English Sentences: Then Paul, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself:
Wolaitta Sentences: Deriyaa haariyaagee PHauloosa oichchin, i hagaadan yaagidi zaariis; "Neeni daro wodiyaasappe doommada, ha asaassi pirddaidda de7iyoogaa taani erada, ta yohuwaa ufaissan zaarais.

English Sentences: Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Yerusalaame goinnanau kiyoosappe tammanne naa77u gallassappe darennaagaa neeni ne huuphen erana danddayaasa.

English Sentences: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the city:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihudati tana Beeta Maqidasiyan gidin, Aihuda woosa keettan gidin, kataman gidin, oonaaranne palamettishin woi asa shiishshada maqqishin, issi uraaranne be7ibookkona.

English Sentences: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ha77ikka tana mootiyoobaa shatimmanau danddayokkona.

English Sentences: But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets:
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin taani hagaa neessi yootais; taani higgiyan de7iyaabaanne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido ubbabaa ammanada, nu aawatu Xoossaassi eti worddo giyo ogiyan goinnais.

English Sentences: And have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageeti bantta huuphen, Asai ubbai, worddoikka xilloikka haiquwaappe denddana giyoogaadan, taanikka eti denddanaagaassi Xoossaa ammanais.

English Sentences: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, and toward men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani qassi, Xoossaa sinttaaninne asaa sinttan ubba wode, pokkoi bainna zoriya wozanai taassi de7ana mala minnais.

English Sentences: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani Yerusalaameppe kiyoosappe daro laittaappe guyyiyan, ta biittaa hiyyeesaassi miishsha immanaunne yarshshuwaa yarshshanau Yerusalaame baas.

English Sentences: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baada hegaa oottishin, asi shiiqennan, ooshshi denddennan, taani Beeta Maqidasiyan geeyishin, eti tana demmidosona.

English Sentences: Who ought to have been here before thee, and object, if they had ought against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Isiyaappe yiida issi issi Aihudati hegan de7oosona; eti ta bolli yoho koyikko, yiidi tana nenan mootanau bessees.

English Sentences: Or else let these same here say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council,
Wolaitta Sentences: Woi taani eta giddon eqqada, Haiqqidaageeti denddanaagaa ammaniyo gishshau, hachchi intte sinttan ta bolli pirddoosona gaada ha xoqqissada haasayido issi qaaleeppe attin, yaa7aa sinttan eqqidaashin,

English Sentences: Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day.
Wolaitta Sentences: tanan issi mooro demmidobaa gidikko, hageeti bantta huuphen hagan yootona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, and said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Pilikisi Xoossaa ogiyaabaa geeshshi erido gishshau, "Taani intte yohuwaa shaalaqaa Lusiyoosi yiyo wode qachchana" yaagidi, pirddiyo wodiyaa sinttau keeriis.

English Sentences: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, and to let him have liberty, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pilikisi qassi PHauloosa qachchennan naagana malanne a dabbotuppe ooninne ayyo oottishin, woi akko yiishin diggenna mala, mato halaqaa azaziis.

English Sentences: And after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida gallassaappe guyyiyan, Pilikisi Aihuda zare gidida ba maccaasee Dirusilliira yiidi, PHauloosa kiitti ehiissidi, Yesuus Kiristtoosan ammaniyoobaa i haasayishin siyiis.

English Sentences: And as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to come, Felix trembled, and answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi xillotettaabaa, ba huuphe naaguwaabaanne yaana pirddaabaa haasayishin, Pilikisi yayyidi, "Neeni ha77issau ba; taassi injjetido wode, nena kiittada xeegissana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode qassi PHauloosi birshshettanau, baassi mattaayiyaa immanddeeshsha giidi qoppiis; hegaa gishshau, darotoo a ehiissi ehiissidi, aara haasayees.

English Sentences: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: and Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u laitta kumidoogaappe guyyiyan, Pilikisa sohuwaa PHorqqiyoosa Pisxxoosi ekkiis. Pilikisi Aihudata ufaissanau koyidi, qasho keettan PHauloosa aggi bayiis.

English Sentences: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pisxxoosi auraajjaa gelido heezzantto gallassaappe guyyiyan, Qiisaariyaappe Yerusalaame biis.

English Sentences: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaani qeese halaqatinne Aihudata kaalettiyaageeti PHauloosa mootidosona.

English Sentences: And desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way to kill him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti PHauloosa woranaassi ogiyan qosetti uttanau, banttana maaddidi a Yerusalaame ehaana mala, Pisxxoosa woossidosona.

English Sentences: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself would depart shortly thither.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woossin Pisxxoosi etassi, "PHauloosi Qiisaariyan qashetti uttiis; taani ta huuphenkka eesuwan yaa guyye simmanau qoppa uttaas.

English Sentences: Let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down with me, and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, i aibakko mooridobai de7ikko, intte giddon aawatiyaageeti tanaara Qiisaariyaa biidi, a mootona" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Caesarea; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pisxxoosi eta matan hosppun woi tammu gallassappe aattennan uttidi, Qiisaariyaa biis; wonttetta gallassi pirddiyoosan uttidi, PHauloosa ehaana mala azaziis.

English Sentences: And when he was come, the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about, and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove.
Wolaitta Sentences: I gakkido wode, Yerusalaameppe yiida Aihudati a lanqqiyan yuuyi aadhdhi eqqidi, banttassi shatimmanau danddayettenna daro deexo mootuwaa a bolli wottidosona.

English Sentences: While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Caesar, have I offended any thing at all.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi mootettiiddi, "Taani Aihudatu higgiyaakka Beeta Maqidasiyaakka Roome Kawuwaa Qeesaarakka ainne naaqqabeikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Festus, willing to do the Jews a pleasure, answered Paul, and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Pisxxoosi Aihudata ufaissanau koyidi PHauloosa, "Pude Yerusalaame kiyada, ha yohuwaabaa yaani ta sinttan pirddettanau koyai?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: Then said Paul, I stand at Caesar's judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin PHauloosi, "Taani pirddettanau bessiyo Qeesaara pirdda keettan eqqaichchaas. Neenikka loitta eriyoogaadan, taani Aihudata ainne naaqqabeikke.

English Sentences: For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi taani naaqqidobaa woi haiqossi bessiyaabaa oottidobaa gidikko, haiquwaappe attana giikke; shin eti tana mootiyo mootoi mela gididoogaappe hini baggan, ooninne tana etassi aattidi immanau danddayenna; Qeesaari tabaa pirddo gaada oichchais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? unto Caesar shalt thou go.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Pisxxoosi banaara zorettiyaageetuura zorettidi a, "Neeni Qeesaari tabaa pirddo gaada oichchadasa; Qeesaarakko baasa" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida gallassaappe guyyiyan, Kawoi Agriiphphinne Barnniiqi Pisxxoosa sarotanau Qiisaariyaa biidosona.

English Sentences: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul's cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaani eti daro gallassaa uttidaashin, Pisxxoosi kawuwaassi PHauloosabaa hagaadan yaagidi yootiis; "Hagan Pilikisi qachchidi aggi bayido issi bitanee de7ees.

English Sentences: About whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Yerusalaamen de7ishin, qeese halaqatinne Aihuda cimati a bolli pirddana mala, tana woossiiddi, abaa taassi yootidosona.

English Sentences: To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Mootettida urai bana mootiyaageetuura issippe eqqennaaninne bana mootido yohuwaassi zaaro immennan, oona gidikkonne aattidi immiyoogee Roome asaassi woga gidenna yaagada etassi zaaraas.

English Sentences: Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought forth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, eti hagan shiiqido wode, taani gam77ennan wonttetta gallassi, pirdda keettaa gelada PHauloosa ehaana mala azazaas.

English Sentences: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:
Wolaitta Sentences: A mootiyaageeti eqqidi, iitaban a mootennan aggokkona gaada taani qoppidoogaadan, ainne a mootibookkona.

English Sentences: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, and of one Jesus, which was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti bantta ammanobaanne PHauloosi, Paxa de7ees giyo haiqqida issi Yesuusa geetettiya bitaniyaabaa aara palamettoosona.

English Sentences: And because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these matters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ha yohuwaa waatada qoranaakko, qachchabeennan de7aidda, PHauloosi Yerusalaame biidi, ha yohuwaa yaani pirddettanau koyiyaakkonne gaada a oichchaas;

English Sentences: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin PHauloosi ba yohuwaa Augisxxoos Qeesaari qachchana gakkanaassi naagettanau oichchin, taani a Qeesaarakko yeddana gakkanaas, i qashettana mala azazaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Agriiphphi Pisxxoosa, "Taani ta huuphenkka qassi he bitanee giyoobaa siyana koyais" yaagiis. Pisxxoosi a, "Neeni wontto i giyoobaa siyana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, and principal men of the city, at Festus' commandment Paul was brought forth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi, Agriiphphinne Barnniiqa daro bonchchuwan shaalaqatuuranne kataman de7iya gita asaara yiidi, pirdda keettaa gelidosona; Pisxxoosi PHauloosa ehaana mala azazin ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And Festus said, King Agrippa, and all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Jerusalem, and also here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ehin Pisxxoosi hagaadan yaagiis; "Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa, hagan nunaara de7iya asa ubbau, Aihuda asai ubbai Yerusalaameenikka hagankka wocamiiddi, I hagaappe sinttan paxa de7anau bessenna yaagidi, tana woossido bitaniyaa hagaa be7eeta.

English Sentences: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ainne haiqossi bessiyaabaa oottidobaa taani demmabeikke; i ba huuphen, Augisxxoosi Qeesaari tabaa pirddo yaagada oichchais giido gishshau, Qeesaarakko a yeddanau ta qofaa qachchaas.

English Sentences: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani abaa ta godaa Augisxxoos Qeesaarassi xaafanau tumu yohoi tau aibinne baawa; hegaa gishshau, i qorettidoogaappe guyyiyan, taani xaafiyoobaa demmana mala, intte sintti, Kawuwau Agriiphphaa, ubba ne sintti a ehaas.

English Sentences: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, qashettida uraa kiittiyo wode, a aissi mootidaakko, erissennan aggiyoogee taassi eeyyatetta misatees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth the hand, and answered for himself:
Wolaitta Sentences: Agriiphphi PHauloosa, "Neeni nebaa haasayanau danddayaasa" yaagiis. He wode PHauloosi ba kushiyaa miccidi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa, Aihudatu wogaanne palamaa ubbaa neeni loittada eriyo gishshau, tana Aihudati mootiyo yoho ubbaa hachchi taani ne sinttan zaariyoogaassi ta qaadai daro lo77o yaagada qoppais;

English Sentences: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
Wolaitta Sentences: hegaa gishshau, neeni ta haasayaa salettennan siyana mala, nena woossais.

English Sentences: My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani naatettaasappe doommada ta asaa giddooninne Yerusalaamen de7ido ta de7uwaa Aihuda ubbati kaseppe doommidi eroosona.

English Sentences: Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani koiroppe doommada, nu ammanuwaa higgiyaa ooppenne minttidi naagiya Parisaawetu bagga Parisaawe gidada de7iyoogaa, eti markkattanau koyikko eroosona.

English Sentences: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ha77ikka Xoossai nu aawatussi immana giidoogaa ufaissan naagiyo gishshau, pirddettanaassi hagan eqqais.

English Sentences: Unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi tammanne naa77u nu aawatu zareti Xoossau qamminne gallassi ubbatoo minttidi goinniiddi, Xoossai immana giidoogaa ekkanau ufaissan naagoosona; Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa, Aihudati tana mootiyoogee taani hegaa ufaissan naagiyo gishshassa.

English Sentences: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihudatoo, Xoossai haiqqidaageeta denttiyoogaa aissi ammanekketii?

English Sentences: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta huuphenkka Naazireeta Yesuusa sunttaa mooriya darobaa oottanau bessees gaada kase qoppaas.

English Sentences: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Yerusalaamen oottidoogee hagaa; qeese halaqatuppe maataa ekkada, Xoossaa asatuppe darota qashissaas; eta woriyo wodekka eta haiquwaa dosaas.

English Sentences: And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihuda woosa keetta ubban daro wode eta qaxxayada, bantta ammanuwaa eti aggana mala godataas; taani wogi bainnaagaa eta hanqqettada, harai atto, hara biitta katamaa gakkanaassikka eta waissais.

English Sentences: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ha yohuwaassi qeese halaqatuppe maataanne azazuwaa ekkada Damasqqo baas.

English Sentences: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwau, taani seeta gallassi ogiyan de7ishin, awaa poo7uwaappe daro aadhdhiya poo7oi tananne tanaara biidaageeta yuuyi aadhdhidi, saluwaappe poo7ishin be7aas.

English Sentences: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ubbaikka sa7an kunddido wode, Ibraisxxe qaalan, Saa7oolaa, Saa7oolaa, tana aissi waissai? Boorai bana caddiya xam77aa qakkiyoogaadan, neeni qakkikko, nena qohaasa yaagidi taassi odishin siyaas.

English Sentences: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Siyada, Ta Godau, neeni oonee? yaagaas. "Godai, Taani neeni waissiyo Yesuusa.

English Sentences: But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin dendda eqqa; aissi giikko, hachchi neeni tana be7idoogaanne taani nena sinttappe bessanaagaa haratussi markkattana mala, ta oosanchcha oottada nena sunttanau neessi beettaas.

English Sentences: Delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti tana ammanin, eta nagarai atto geetettanaadan, Xoossai doorido asaa giddon eti bantta sohuwaa demmanaadan, qassi xumaappe poo7uwaa simmanaadaaninne xalahiyaa godatettaappekka Xoossaakko simmanaadan,

English Sentences: To open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
Wolaitta Sentences: eta aifiyaa neeni dooyana mala, Israa7eela asaappenne taani nena etakko kiittiyo Aihuda gidennaageetuppe nena ashshana yaagiis.

English Sentences: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa, hegaa gishshau, taassi saluwaappe beettida ajjuutaassi taani azazettanaagaa ixxabeikke.

English Sentences: But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani kasetada, Damasqqooninne Yerusalaamen hegaappe guyyiyan, Yihudaa biitta ubban de7iyaageetussinne Aihuda gidennaageetussi bantta nagaraappe simmana mala, qassi nagaraappe simmanau bessiyaabaa oottiiddi, Xoossaakko simmana mala qaalaa yootaas.

English Sentences: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Aihudati tana Beeta Maqidasiyan oiqqidi woranau koyidosona.

English Sentences: Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani Xoossaa maaduwaa ekkada, gitaassinne guuttaassi hachchi gakkanaassikka eqqada markkattais.

English Sentences: That Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyaageetinne Muusee, Kiristtoosi waayettana bessees; qassi haiquwaappe koiro denddidi, Aihudatussinne Aihuda gidennaageetussi atotettaa poo7uwaa yootanau bessees giidoogaadan, taanikka eti haasayidoogaappe haraa issibaakka haasayidobi baawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi babaa hagaadan yaagidi zaarishin, Pisxxoosi qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, "PHauloosaa, neeni gooyaasa; neeni daro tamaaridoogee nena gooshshana hanees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin PHauloosi hagaadan yaagiis; "Bonchcho Pisxxoosaa, taani tumu yohuwaanne wozanaa qofaa haasayiyoogaappe attin gooyikke.

English Sentences: For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Kawuwaa Agriiphphassi ha yohuwaa qassi qoncciyan yootiyoogaa i erees; aissi giikko, ha yohoi geeman oosettibeenna gishshau, hagaappe issoinne appe geemmennaagaa taani geeshshada erais.

English Sentences: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa, neeni hananabaa yootiyaageetubaa ammanai? Neeni etabaa ammaniyoogaa taani erais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Agriiphphi PHauloosa, "Hanni keesenkka tana ammanttanau koyai?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin PHauloosi, "Daro wode gidin, guutta wode gidin, ne xalaala gidakka; shin hachchi taani yootiyoogaa siyiya ubbai qassi ha qashuwaappe attin, ta mala gidanau Xoossaa woossais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoikka, Pisxxoosikka, Barnniiqakka, etaara uttida ubbaikka denddidi,

English Sentences: And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
Wolaitta Sentences: issi baggi simmidi, issoi issuwaara, "Ha bitanee haiqoi atto shin, qashossikka bessiyaabaa oottibeenna" yaagidi haasayidosona.

English Sentences: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.
Wolaitta Sentences: Agriiphphi Pisxxoosa, "Ha bitanee, Qeesaari tabaa pirddo gibeennaakko, birshshettana danddayees shin" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus' band.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni markkabiyan Xaaliyaa baanau qachchido wode, PHauloosanne hara amarida qashuwaa asata Augisxxoosa wotaaddarata giyoogeetuppe issi Yuuliyoosa giyo mato halaqaassi aattidi immidosona.

English Sentences: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isiyaa gaxan de7iya biittata biya Adiraamixiyoona markkabiyan gelidi denddida; Maqidooniyaa asa gidiya Tasalonqqee Arisxxirokoosi nunaara de7ees.

English Sentences: And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi nuuni Sidoona gakkishin, Yuuliyoosi PHauloosassi kehidi a, "Ne dabboti nena maaddana mala, neeni etakko baanau danddayaasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe denddidi, sinttaara nu bolli carkkiyo gishshau, Qophphiroosa haruuruwan carkkenna baggi biida.

English Sentences: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kilqqiyaa mataaninne PHinifiliyaa matan de7iya abbaa pinnidi, Luqiyan de7iya Mura gakkida.

English Sentences: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegan mato halaqai Xaaliyaa biya Iskkinddiriyaa markkabiyaa demmidi, aani nuna gelissiis.

English Sentences: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni daro gallassaa loddaara biiddi, daro tuggan Qaniidoose ginaa gakkida; hegaara baanau nuna carkkoi diggin Salmmoonaara aadhdhidi, Qarxxeesen carkkenna baggi biida.

English Sentences: And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka daro tuggan gaxaara gaxaara aadhdhidi, Luqiyaa katamaa matan de7iya abbaa doonan markkabee woppu giidi shemppiyoosaa giyoosaa yiida.

English Sentences: Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished them,
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni hegan daro wodiyaa gam77idoogaappe guyyiyan, Xoomai birshshettiichchido gishshau, markkabiyan biyoogeekka hirggissin PHauloosi eta zoriiddi,

English Sentences: And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asau, nu buussan gita boshainne daro qohoi de7anaagee tau beettees; bashshai yiyoogee caanaa bollanne markkabiyaa bolla xalaalaani gidenna; nu shemppuwaa bollikka yaana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin mato halaqai PHauloosi giidoogaappe aattidi, markkabiyan de7iyaageeta azaziyaageenne markkabiyaa godai giyoogaa ammanees.

English Sentences: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.
Wolaitta Sentences: He abbaa doona katamai balgguwaa shaaccanau etassi injjetenna katama; hegaa gishshau, dariya asati banttau danddayettikko, Pinqqe giyo katamaa gakkidi, balgguwaa yaani shaaccana mala, yaappe denddanau zorettidosona; Pinqqee awai wulliyoosaappenne ushachchappe gidduwan, qassi wulliyoosaappenne haddirssappe gidduwan de7iya abbaa doona katama.

English Sentences: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tohossa bagga carkkoi loddaara carkkido wode, bantta qoppidoogaadan hanidabaa etassi milatin denddidosona; markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya birataa pude dafidi, Qarxxeese matattidi, lanqqiyaara aadhdhidosona.

English Sentences: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin daro gam77ennan, "Auraaqiis" giyo daro wolqqaama gotee haruuruwaappe duge eta bolli denddiis.

English Sentences: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gotee markkabiyaa dechchidi aattennan diggin, baanau nuuyyo danddayettennan ixxido gishshau, markkabiyaa i efiyoosaa yeddi bayidi biida.

English Sentences: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni Qeeda giyo haruuruwan geemmido wode, daro tuggatidi markkabiyaa wolwoluwaa teqqanau danddayida.

English Sentences: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti wolwoluwaa pude kessidoogaappe guyyiyan, wodoruwan markkabiyaa xaaxidi, mintti qachchidosona; Sirttiisa giyo shafiyan banttana oogganaakkonne giidi hirggidi, markkabiyaa efiya sharaa wottidi, carkkuwan markkabiyaa coo yeddi bayidosona.

English Sentences: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;
Wolaitta Sentences: Gotee wolqqaamidi nuna tuggayin, wonttetta gallassi caanaappe abban oluwaa doommidosona.

English Sentences: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzantto gallassikka markkabiyan de7iya miishshaa eti bantta kushiyan olidosona.

English Sentences: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni daro gallassaa awa aifiyaanne xoolinttiyaa be7ennan, wolqqaama uushoi nu bolli uushishin, sinttappe xayana giidi qoppida.

English Sentences: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti daro gallassaa katta meennan gam77idoogaappe guyyiyan, PHauloosi he wode eta giddon denddi eqqidi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Asau, intte ta zoriyaa ekkidobaa gidiyaakkonne Qarxxeeseppe denddennan aggidaakko, ha bashshainne qohoi nuna gakkenna.

English Sentences: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man's life among you, but of the ship.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77ikka taani inttena yayyoppite gaada zorais; aissi giikko, ha markkabee xayanaappe attin, intteppe issi uraa shemppoikka xayenna.

English Sentences: For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossaa kiitanchchai, tana haarida taani goinniyo Xoossaagee, zine qammi ta matan eqqidi,

English Sentences: Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosaa, yayyoppa; neeni Roome biittaa Kawuwaa Qeesaara sinttan eqqanau bessees; be7a, Xoossai nenaara biya asa ubbaa shemppuwaa ashshana yaagiis.

English Sentences: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau asau, yayyoppite. Aissi giikko, he kiitanchchai tau odidoogaadan hananaagaa taani Xoossaa ammanais;

English Sentences: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin carkkoi nuna issi haruuruwan abbaa doonan olana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;
Wolaitta Sentences: Tammanne oiddantto qamman Meediteraane Abban nuna carkkoi yaanne haanne sugishin, markkabiyan oottiyaageetussi qamma bilahe biittaakko matidobaa milatiis.

English Sentences: And sounded, and found it twenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and found it fifteen fathoms.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti likkiyo wodoruwaa xeeran deexxiyaabaa qachchidi, haattan yeggin, haattai hosppun tammu wara ciimmatidoogaa eridosona. Guuttaa gam77iiddi, naa77anttuwaa yeggidi, usuppun tammu wara ciimmatidoogaa eridosona.

English Sentences: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti shuchchattiyaasan kunddenna mala yayyidi, markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya oiddu birataa markkabiyaappe guyyeera abban yeggidi, sa7ai wonttana mala, Xoossaa woossoosona.

English Sentences: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,
Wolaitta Sentences: Markkabiyan oottiyaageeti markkabiyaappe baqatanau koyidi, markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya amarida biratata markkabiyaappe sintta baggaara abban yeggiyaabaa milatidi, wolwoluwaa abban wottido wode,

English Sentences: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi mato halaqaanne wotaaddarata, "Hageeti markkabe giddon de7ana xayikko, intte attanau danddayekketa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, wotaaddarati wolwoloi qashettido wodoruwaa qanxxidi, yeddi bayidosona.

English Sentences: And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai wonttana hanishin, PHauloosi ubbai qumaa maana mala, hagaadan yaagidi woossiis; "Intte hachchiira tammanne oiddu gallassaa naagideta; qassi he ubbankka quma mibeekketa.

English Sentences: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, guutta qumaa intte maana mala, taani inttena woossais; aissi giikko, intte paxa de7anau guutta qumaa maana koshshees; harai atto intte huuphiyaa binnaanaappe issoikka xayenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had broken it, he began to eat.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi hagaa giidi, oittaa ekkidi, ubbaa sinttan Xoossaa galatiis; menttidi Muussaa doommiis.

English Sentences: Then were they all of good cheer, and they also took some meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Doommin ubbai minettidi, banttaukka qassi qumaa miidosona.

English Sentences: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni markkabiyan de7iyaageeti naa77u xeetanne laappun tammanne usuppuna.

English Sentences: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti miidi kallido wode, caana gisttiyaa abban olidi markkabiyaa deexuwaa kaushshidosona.

English Sentences: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai wonttido wode, markkabiyan oottiyaageeti biittaa eribookkona; shin haattai goggidi abban gelidosaa lanqqiyan de7iya shafiyaa akeeki xeellidosona. Banttassi danddayettiyaakko, markkabiyaa he shafiyaakko laagganau bantta qofaa qachchidosona.

English Sentences: And when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves unto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya biratata birshshidi, abbaa giddo yeggidosona; he wode, markkabiyaa koyidosaa zaaridi laaggiyo mittaa qachchido wodoruwaa birshshidosona; hegaappe guyyiyan, carkkoi markkabiyaa sinttau sugana mala, markkabiyaa efiya sharaa sintta baggaara xoqqu oottidi, buussaa doommidosona.

English Sentences: And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin markkabee naa77u abbai gaittidosan de7iya shafiyan dom77ettidi ohettiis; markkabiyaassi guyye baggai beetaa sugettan meqerettishin, sintta baggai xishettidi, qaaxxennan ixxi aggiis.

English Sentences: And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wotaaddarati qashuwaa asaappe issoinne haattaa wodhdhidi kessi ekkenna mala, eta woranau zorettidosona.

English Sentences: But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from their purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea, and get to land:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin mato halaqai PHauloosa ashshanau koyidi, wotaaddaratu zoretaa ixxiis; haattaa waraa eriya ubbai markkabiyaappe haattan guppi guppidi kasetidi gaxaa kiyana mala azaziis.

English Sentences: And the rest, some on boards, and some on broken pieces of the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Attidaageetuppe baggati sanqqan, baggati markkabiyaa me7uwan kiyana mala azaziis; hegaadan ubbatikka gaxaa saro kiyidosona.

English Sentences: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni gaxaa saro kiyido wode, haruuroi Maltta geetettiyoogaa erida.

English Sentences: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haruuruwaa asati nuussi daro kehaa kehidosona; irai bukkanau doommido gishshaunne meeggiyo gishshau, tamaa eettidi, nuna ubbaa mokkidosona.

English Sentences: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi daro qaixaariyaa qoridi taman wottishin, shooshshai mishuwaa gishshau kiyidi, a kushiyan xaaxettidi, a dukkiis.

English Sentences: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haruuruwaa asati shooshshai PHauloosa kushiyan xaaxettidaagaa be7ido wode issoi issuwaassi, "Tumu ha bitanee shemppo woriya asa; harai atto abbaappe i attinkka Xoossaa pirddai a paxa de7o gibeenna" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin PHauloosi ba kushiyaappe shooshshaa wuxakkidi, taman oliis; a ainne oottibeenna.

English Sentences: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti, "A bollai kixxees; woi akeekennan kunddidi haiqqees" yaagidi a naagoosona; shin daro wodiyaa naagidi, a bollan aibinne dummatidabi xayin, "Hagee xoossa" yaagidi bantta qofaa aggi bayidosona.

English Sentences: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa heeran haruuruwaa halaqaa Pupiliyoosa giyoogaassi gadee de7ees; i nuna mokkidi, heezzu gallassaa siiquwan imattiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pupiliyoosa aawai qoxo, mishonne ulo kara sahetti zin77idi de7ees; PHauloosi a soo gelidi, ayyo Xoossaa woossiis; ba kushiyaa a bolli wottidi, a pattiis.

English Sentences: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, he haruuruwan harggiya hara asaikka qassi yiidi paxiis.

English Sentences: Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Paxin nuna daro bonchchuwaa bonchchidosona; nuuni markkabiyan baanau denddido wode, ogiyau nuna koshshiyaabaa nuussi immidosona.

English Sentences: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu aginaappe guyyiyan, haruuruwan balgguwaa aattidi Diyoosqqoroosa giyo Iskkinddiriyaa markkabiyan baanau denddida.

English Sentences: And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni Siraakuse giyo katamaa gelidi, yaani heezzu gallassaa uttida.

English Sentences: And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe yuuyiiddi, Regiiyume giyo katamaa gakkida. Issi gallassappe guyyiyan, tohossa bagga carkkoi carkkin, wonttetta gallassi Putiyoluusa giyo katamaa yiida.

English Sentences: Where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegan nuuni issi issi ammaniyaageeta demmin, banttanaara laappun gallassaa uttana mala, nuna woossidosona; hegaadankka qassi Roome yiida.

English Sentences: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.
Wolaitta Sentences: Roomen de7iya ammaniyaageeti nubaa siyidi, Afiyoosa Giyaanne Heezzu Aqiyoosaa giyoosaa gakkanaassi nuna mokkanau yiidosona; PHauloosi eta be7ido wode Xoossaa galatidi, wozanan minettiis.

English Sentences: And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni Roome gelido wode, PHauloosi bana naagiya wotaaddaraara barkka de7ana mala azazettiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Men and brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu gallassaappe guyyiyan, PHauloosi Aihudatu halaqata baakko xeesiis; eti shiiqido wode, eta hagaadan yaagiis; "Ta ishatoo, taani nu asaa woi nu aawatu wogaa phalqqiyaabaa ainne oottennan, tana Yerusalaamen qachchidi, Roome asaassi aattidi immidosona.

English Sentences: Who, when they had examined me, would have let me go, because there was no cause of death in me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti tana qoridi, haiqossi bessiyaabai ta bolli ainne bainna gishshau, tana birshshanau qoppidosona.

English Sentences: But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hegaa Aihudati maayennan ixxido wode, Tabaa Qeesaari pirddo gaanaagee tana koshshiisippe attin, taani ta zariyaa mootiyoobai taassi de7iina gidenna.

English Sentences: For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see you, and to speak with you: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani inttenaara gaittanaunne haasayanau inttena xeesidoogee hegaassa; aissi giikko, Israa7eela asai ufaissan naagiyoogaa gishshataassi taani ha sanssalatan qashettaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aihuda cimati PHauloosa, "Nuuni Yihudaappe nebau dabddaabbe ekkibookko. Nu ishanttuppekka harai atto, issoikka yiidi, nebaa odibeenna; woi ne sunttaa mooridi, nuuyyo odibeenna.

English Sentences: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin he asaa sunttaa ubbasan asai mooridi haasayiyoogaa nuuni eriyo gishshau, ne qofaa siyanau koyoos" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and out of the prophets, from morning till evening.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta yaana gallassaa PHauloosassi keeridi, he gallassi daridi i de7iyoosaa yiidosona; yin i etassi Xoossaa kawotettaabaa markkattiis. Qassi eti Yesuusabaa ammanana mala, Muuse higgiyaappenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafidoogaappe bochchidi eta tamaarissiiddi, maalladoppe omarssi gakkanaassi loittidi yootiis.

English Sentences: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baggati PHauloosi giidoogaa ammanidosona; shin baggati ammanibookkona.

English Sentences: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta giddon yohuwaa maayettennan ixxido wode, PHauloosi issibaa giidoogaappe guyyiyan biidosona; i hagaadan yaagiis; "Geeshsha Ayyaanai nu aawatussi hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasan,

English Sentences: Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni he asaakko baada hagaadan ga; "Intte sissaa siyana, shin intteyyo gelenna; intte xeeluwaa xeellana, shin be7ekketa.

English Sentences: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ha asaa wozanai dammiis; bantta haittaa tulissidosona; bantta aifiyaakka qilimmidosona. Hegee bainnaakko, bantta aifiyan be7ana; eta haittaikka siyana; eta wozanaikka akeekana; eti taakko Xoossaakko simmana. Qassi taanikka eta pattana" yaaga yaagiis.

English Sentences: Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and that they will hear it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi hagee Xoossaa atotettai, Aihuda gidennaageetussi kiitettidoogee inttessi eretto. Qassi etikka siyana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi hegaa giidoogaappe guyyiyan, Aihudati bantta giddon daro palamettiiddi biidosona.

English Sentences: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,
Wolaitta Sentences: PHauloosi kera keettan naa77u laitta kumettaa de7iiddi, baakko yiya ubbaa mokkees.

English Sentences: Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bana ooninne diggennan Xoossaa kawotettaabaanne Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosabaa yootiiddi, yayyennan daro qonccissidi tamaarissiis.
